translated: Elliot, Erik Holger, president, Gothenburg, born November 3, 1887 in Stockholm to President Erik E. and Hildegard Stråle af Ekna. He took a law degree in Uppsala in 1910. He served as an assistant in the Ministry of Justice with an emphasis on military laws from 1925 to 1936 and then with social, financial, agricultural, and justice departments from 1925 to 27, 1929 to 30, and 1939 to 1940 respectively. He was also a court assessor in the Svea Court of Appeal from 1926, a military judge assistant from 1928, a revenue secretary from 1929, and a military judge from 1930 to 1933. He resumed his role as a court assessor in 1936, became president of the Upper Norrland Court of Appeal in 1935, and the president of the Western Sweden Court of Appeal from 1948. He was a member of the board of scientific council from 1933 to 1936, a member of the board for the Life Insurance Company Nordstjernan from 1921 to 1932, the General Widow and Orphan Fund director in 1936, and the Carnegie Foundation chairman in 1937. Knight of the Order of Vasa. He married in 19xx.
